\index{Time Routines@{Time Routines}!apr\+\_\+ctime@{apr\+\_\+ctime}}
\index{apr\+\_\+ctime@{apr\+\_\+ctime}!Time Routines@{Time Routines}}
\subsubsection[{\texorpdfstring{apr\+\_\+ctime(char $\ast$date\+\_\+str, apr\+\_\+time\+\_\+t t)}{apr_ctime(char *date_str, apr_time_t t)}}]{\setlength{\rightskip}{0pt plus 5cm}{\bf apr\+\_\+status\+\_\+t} apr\+\_\+ctime (
\begin{DoxyParamCaption}
\item[{char $\ast$}]{date\+\_\+str, }
\item[{{\bf apr\+\_\+time\+\_\+t}}]{t}
\end{DoxyParamCaption}
)}\hypertarget{group__apr__time_gad1fcb8f26d508fbb34ea2beca7bc851e}{}\label{group__apr__time_gad1fcb8f26d508fbb34ea2beca7bc851e}
apr\+\_\+ctime formats dates in the ctime() format in an efficient manner. It is a fixed length format and requires A\+P\+R\+\_\+\+C\+T\+I\+M\+E\+\_\+\+L\+EN bytes of storage including the trailing N\+UL terminator. Unlike A\+N\+S\+I/\+I\+SO C ctime(), \hyperlink{group__apr__time_gad1fcb8f26d508fbb34ea2beca7bc851e}{apr\+\_\+ctime()} does not include a \textbackslash{}n at the end of the string. 
\begin{DoxyParams}{Parameters}
{\em date\+\_\+str} & String to write to. \\
\hline
{\em t} & the time to convert \\
\hline
\end{DoxyParams}
